Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.pre.controlflowhelpers

Class AbstractRemoteContinuation<ParameterType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent.AbstractTask
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.pre.controlflowhelpers.AbstractContinuation<ParameterType>
        • fr.sorbonne_u.components.pre.controlflowhelpers.AbstractRemoteContinuation<ParameterType>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentI.ComponentTask, ContinuationI<ParameterType>, Serializable, Runnable
    public abstract class AbstractRemoteContinuation<ParameterType>
extends AbstractContinuation<ParameterType>
implements Serializable
    The class AbstractRemoteContinuation

    Description

    TODO: continuations in this package are assumed to be executed by the executor service of the owner component. It would be interesting to be able to pass continuations to other components but make sure they are executed in their owner component as tasks when they are called. To do this, a callback to the owner component through its reflection interface is possible. However, he question is how to know if the continuation is local or remote. One possibility would be to identify the owner component through the thread currently executing the code, which is possible if we control the creation of threads in executors by using thread factories and naming the threads with URIs kept by the component.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2018-09-18

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
